ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: Experience in research through collections, understanding of museum functions and day-to-day practices, practical research skills like statistical methods and scientific writing.
How to conduct scientific research; how the Peabody Museum works in terms of collecting, curation, and organization; how scientists write about and present their findings.
I gained numerous insights and skills from taking this course. I found how I could utilize resources through the Peabody Museum, such as Horse Island and high-tech equipment.
I learned more about the scientific method by actually engaging in a hands on science project.

I learned how to develop a research question and write a long form research paper. In a broader sense, I learned about how museum collections function and how to take advantage of them during my time at Yale.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments:
Strengths: Very free-form/independent, small class size with collaboration heavily encouraged, close connection to multiple distinguished faculty.

Weaknesses: Few assignments with great weight being placed on one project.

Strengths: many mentors for each student to guide them through the process of developing and carrying out a research project; access to the incredible resources of the museum and its collections; opportunities to carry out cutting-edge research. Weaknesses: little guidance on what was expected of students for course assignments; few opportunities for feedback throughout the semester.
The strength of this course was the ability to conduct research that was on the forefront of a field.
I think it was really cool to work on a project about something I didnt know about, but at times, it felt a little too free flowing and unguided, which was something I had to get used to.

This was a truly fantastic class, I wouldn't change a thing. It allowed each student to take responsibility for their time, and I think the looser structure really helped me find balance in the research and coursework. Additionally, each class meeting was productive and fulfilling.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Absolutely! The ability to explore the museum was incredible, the instructors and mentors are beyond available regarding everything from the content of your independent research to the transition to college life, and the experience is invaluable to anyone interested in the environment, paleontology, archaeology, or adjacent fields.

Yes, if you are willing and excited to create your own research project and carry it out with high levels of independence. The mentors understand students' skill levels in the various topics and help guide them through their individual processes. Students essentially create their own schedule and timeline for their projects, so they have some autonomy over their engagement in the class.

I would absolutely recommend this course to another student. The opportunities I gained through this course provided me with a very exciting first semester and allowed me to further define my interests.
Yes, it is super cool and a very unique opportunity.

100%. As a non-stem student, I was very intimidated by research and didn't really understand what it looked like within the humanities. This class totally demystified the process and made it more accessible. I'm leaving this class with a research paper I'm proud of as well as connections in my fields of interest. I can't think of a more worthwhile learning experience.
